trans-unit.source: Represents the abstract base class for all keys that are generated using symmetric algorithms.
Typically, this class is used by the infrastructure to transform XML using a symmetric key.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SymmetricSecurityKey"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, generates a derived key using the specified cryptographic algorithm and parameters for the current key.
To specify P-SHA1 as the cryptographic algorithm, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms.Psha1KeyDerivation> field.
A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm to use to generate the derived key.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the label parameter for the cryptographic algorithm.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the nonce that is used to create a derived key.
The size of the derived key.
The position at which the derived key is located in the byte array that is returned from this method.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the derived key.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a transform that decrypts cipher text using the specified cryptographic algorithm.
Use the fields that represent decryption algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.
A cryptographic algorithm that decrypts cipher text, such as encrypted XML.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the initialization vector (`IV`) for the specified algorithm.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform"></xref> that represents the decryption transform.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a transform that encrypts XML using the specified cryptographic algorithm.
Use the fields that represent decryption algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.
A cryptographic algorithm that encrypts XML.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the initialization vector (`IV`) for the specified algorithm.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform"></xref> that represents the encryption transform.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the size, in bits, of the initialization vector (`IV`) that is required for the specified cryptographic algorithm.
The cryptographic algorithm to get the size of the initialization vector (`IV`).
The size, in bits, of the initialization vector (`IV`) that is required for the cryptographic algorithm specified in the algorithm parameter.
When overridden in a derived class, gets an instance of the specified keyed hash algorithm.
Use the fields that represent keyed hash algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.
The keyed hash algorithm to get an instance of.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.KeyedHashAlgorithm"></xref> that represents the keyed hash algorithm.
When overridden in a derived class, gets an instance of the specified symmetric algorithm.
Use the fields that represent symmetric algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.
The symmetric algorithm to get an instance of.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm"></xref> that represents the symmetric algorithm.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the bytes that represent the symmetric key.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the symmetric key.
